sen.j: 水野 忠邦（みずの ただくに）は、江戸時代の大名・老中。
sen.e: Tadakuni MIZUNO was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) and roju (senior councilor of the Tokugawa shogunate) lived during the Edo Period.
Tadakuni MIZUNO was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) and roju (senior councilor of the Tokugawa shogunate) lived during the Edo Period.
Tadakuni MIZUNO was a daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) and roju (senior councilor of the Tokugawa shogunate) who lived during the Edo Period.

tit.j: 出生・唐津・浜松藩主時代
tit.e: From birth to a lord of the Karatsu and Hamamatsu Domains
From birth to a lord of the Karatsu and Hamamatsu Domains
From birth to a lord of the Karatsu and Hamamatsu Domains

sen.j: 寛政6年（1794年）6月23日、唐津藩第3代藩主・水野忠光の次男として生まれる。
sen.e: Tadakuni was born the second son to the third lord of the Karatsu Domain, Tadaaki MIZUNO, on June 23, 1794.
Tadakuni was born as the second son to the third lord of the Karatsu Domain, Tadaaki MIZUNO, on June 23, 1794.
Tadakuni was born as the second son to the third lord of the Karatsu Domain, Tadaaki MIZUNO, on June 23, 1794.

sen.j: 長兄の芳丸が早世したため、文化 (元号)2年（1805年）に唐津藩の世子となり、文化4年（1807年）に第11代征夷大将軍徳川家斉と世子・徳川家慶に謁見する。
sen.e: As the eldest brother, Fusamaru, died young, Tadakuni became an heir of the Karatsu Domain in 1805 and had an audience with the 11th Seii Taishogun (commander-in-chief of the expeditionary force against the barbarians), Ienari TOKUGAWA, and his heir, Ieyoshi TOKUGAWA in 1807.

As the eldest brother, Fusamaru, died young, Tadakuni became an heir of the Karatsu Domain in 1805 and had an audience with the 11th Seii Taishogun (commander-in-chief of the expeditionary force against the barbarians), Ienari TOKUGAWA, and his heir, Ieyoshi TOKUGAWA in 1807.

As the eldest brother, Fusamaru, died young, Tadakuni became an heir of the Karatsu Domain in 1805 and had an audience with the 11th Seii Taishogun (commander-in-chief of the expeditionary force against the barbarians), Ienari TOKUGAWA, and his heir, Ieyoshi TOKUGAWA in 1807.

sen.j: そして従五位下・式部少輔に叙位・任官した。
sen.e: Tadakuni was appointed as shikibu shoyu (Junior Assistant of the Ministry of Ceremonial) and conferred a rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
Tadakuni was appointed as shikibu shoyu (Junior Assistant of the Ministry of Ceremonial) and was conferred the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
sen.cmt: conferredを受動態にし、aをtheにしました。
sen.e: Tadakuni was appointed as shikibu shoyu (Junior Assistant of the Ministry of Ceremonial) and was conferred the rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 文化9年（1812年）に父・忠光が隠居したため、家督を相続する。
sen.e: When Tadakuni's father, Tadaaki, was retired in 1812, Tadakuni succeeded the reigns of the family.
When Tadakuni's father, Tadaaki, retired in 1812, Tadakuni succeeded the reigns of the family.
When Tadakuni's father, Tadaaki, retired in 1812, Tadakuni succeeded the reigns of the family.

sen.j: 文化13年（1816年）に奏者番となる。
sen.e: He was promoted to sojaban (an official in charge of the ceremonies) in 1816.
He assumed the position of sojaban (an official in charge of the ceremonies) in 1816.
He assumed the position of sojaban (an official in charge of the ceremonies) in 1816.

sen.j: 忠邦は奏者番以上の昇格を望んだが、唐津藩が長崎警備の任務を負うことから昇格に障害が生じると知るや、家臣の諫言を押しきって文化14年（1817年）9月、実封25万3000石の唐津から実封15万3000石の浜松藩への転封を自ら願い出て実現させた。
sen.e: As soon as Tadakuni, who sought further promotions beyond sojaban, recognized that the Karatsu Domain, which was assigned to defend Nagasaki, impeded such promotions, he requested bakufu against his vassals' advice and finally realized in September 1817 to change his domain from the Karatsu Domain with 253,000 goku (70,334 cubic meters) to the Hamamatsu Domain with 153,000 goku (42,534 cubic meters).

As soon as Tadakuni, who sought further promotions beyond sojaban, recognized that the Karatsu Domain, which was assigned to defend Nagasaki, impeded such promotions, he, against his vassals' advice, requested bakufu to change his domain from the Karatsu Domain with 253,000 koku (70,334 cubic meters) to the Hamamatsu Domain with 153,000 koku (42,534 cubic meters), and finally realized it in September, 1817.
sen.cmt: gokuをkokuとし、語順を変えました。
sen.e: As soon as Tadakuni, who sought further promotions beyond sojaban, recognized that the Karatsu Domain, which was assigned to defend Nagasaki, impeded such promotions, he, against his vassals' advice, requested bakufu to change his domain from the Karatsu Domain with 253,000 koku (70,334 cubic meters) to the Hamamatsu Domain with 153,000 koku (42,534 cubic meters), and finally realized it in September, 1817.

sen.j: この国替顛末の時、水野家家老・二本松義廉が忠邦に諌死をして果てている。
sen.e: During this domain transfer, the chief retainer of the Mizuno clan, Yoshikado NIHONMATSU, died in remonstration.
During this domain transfer, the chief retainer of the Mizuno clan, Yoshikado NIHONMATSU, died in remonstration.
During this domain transfer, the chief retainer of the Mizuno clan, Yoshikado NIHONMATSU, died in remonstration.

sen.j: また唐津藩から一部天領に召し上げられた地域があり、地元民には国替えの工作のための賄賂として使われたのではないかという疑念と、天領の年貢の取立てが厳しかったことから、後年まで恨まれている。
sen.e: Because a part of the Karatsu Domain was taken away by bakufu as a shogunal demesne, the domain people, who suspected that the land was used as a bribe to realize the domain transfer, had to suffer a harsh tax collection in the demesne and held a grudge against Tadakuni well into later years.

The people in the domain held a grudge against Tadakuni well into later years, because a part of the Karatsu Domain was taken away by bakufu as a shogunal demesne, and they suspected that this was used as a bribe to realize the domain transfer, and they also suffered a harsh tax collection in the demesne.
sen.cmt: 語順を変えて書き換えました。
sen.e: The people in the domain held a grudge against Tadakuni well into later years, because a part of the Karatsu Domain was taken away by bakufu as a shogunal demesne, and they suspected that this was used as a bribe to realize the domain transfer, and they also suffered a harsh tax collection in the demesne.

sen.j: この国替えによる功により、同年に寺社奉行兼任となる。
sen.e: In recognition of his service in achieving the domain transfer, Tadakuni was also appointed as jisha bugyo (magistrate of temples and shrines) in the same year.
In recognition of his service in achieving the domain transfer, Tadakuni was also appointed as jisha bugyo (magistrate of temples and shrines) in the same year.
In recognition of his service in achieving the domain transfer, Tadakuni was also appointed as jisha bugyo (magistrate of temples and shrines) in the same year.

sen.j: その後、将軍・家斉のもとで頭角を現し、文政8年（1825年）に大坂城代となり、従四位下に昇位する。
sen.e: Since then, Tadakuni had made remarkable progress under the shogun, Ienari, and got a promotion to Osaka jodai (the keeper of Osaka Castle) and was conferred the rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Forth Rank, Lower Grade) in 1825.

Since then, Tadakuni had made remarkable progress under the shogun, Ienari, and got a promotion to Osaka jodai (the keeper of Osaka Castle) and was conferred the rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Forth Rank, Lower Grade) in 1825.

Since then, Tadakuni had made remarkable progress under the shogun, Ienari, and got a promotion to Osaka jodai (the keeper of Osaka Castle) and was conferred the rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Forth Rank, Lower Grade) in 1825.

sen.j: 文政9年（1826年）に京都所司代となって侍従・越前守に昇叙し、文政11年（1828年）に西の丸老中となって将軍世子・徳川家慶の補佐役を務めた。
sen.e: He was promoted again to Kyoto shoshidai (The Kyoto deputy) and conferred a title of jiju (Imperial Household Agency staff) and Echizen no kami (Governor of Echizen Province) in 1826, followed by a further promotion in 1828 to roju of Nishinomaru Goten Palace to support Ieyoshi TOKUGAWA, a shogunal heir.

He was promoted again to Kyoto shoshidai (The Kyoto deputy) and was conferred the title of jiju (Imperial Household Agency staff) and Echizen no kami (Governor of Echizen Province) in 1826, followed by a further promotion in 1828 to roju (member of shogun's council of elders) of Nishinomaru Goten Palace to support Ieyoshi TOKUGAWA, a shogunal heir.
sen.cmt: 老中の説明を加えました。 Conferredを受動態にし、aをtheにしました。
sen.e: He was promoted again to Kyoto shoshidai (The Kyoto deputy) and was conferred the title of jiju (Imperial Household Agency staff) and Echizen no kami (Governor of Echizen Province) in 1826, followed by a further promotion in 1828 to roju (member of shogun's council of elders) of Nishinomaru Goten Palace to support Ieyoshi TOKUGAWA, a shogunal heir.

sen.j: 天保5年（1834年）に水野忠成が病没したため、代わって本丸老中に任ぜられ、天保8年（1837年）に勝手御用掛を兼ねて、天保10年（1839年）に老中首座となった。
sen.e: To replace Tadaakira MIZUNO, who died of disease in 1834, Tadakuni was appointed as roju of Honmaru Palace, and also promoted to roju shuza (the head of roju) in 1839 after additionally held the post of katte goyo-gakari (director of finance) in 1837.
sen.cmt: 勝手御用掛：director of financeと訳しています。
sen.e: To replace Tadaakira MIZUNO, who died of disease in 1834, Tadakuni was appointed as roju of Honmaru Palace, and also promoted to roju shuza (the head of roju) in 1839 after additionally held the post of katte goyo-gakari (director of finance) in 1837.

To replace Tadaakira MIZUNO, who died of disease in 1834, Tadakuni was appointed as roju of Honmaru Palace, and also promoted to roju shuza (the head of roju) in 1839 after additionally held the post of katte goyo-gakari (director of finance) in 1837.

sen.j: 忠邦は異国船が日本近海に相次いで出没して日本の海防を脅かす一方、年貢米収入が激減し、一方で大御所時代のなか、放漫な財政に打つ手を見出せない江戸幕府に強い危機感を抱いていたとされる。
sen.e: While foreign ships threatened the Japanese coastal defense by appearing in waters around Japan, it is believed that Tadakuni was feeling a strong sense of danger against Edo bakufu that could not find any solution for loose management of finance which suffered a significant income decline in annual rice tax during the Ogosho (retired Shogun) period.

While foreign ships threatened the Japanese coastal defense by appearing in waters around Japan, it is believed that Tadakuni was feeling a strong sense of danger against Edo bakufu that could not find any solution for loose management of finance which suffered a significant income decline in annual rice tax during the Ogosho (retired Shogun) period.

While foreign ships threatened the Japanese coastal defense by appearing in waters around Japan, it is believed that Tadakuni was feeling a strong sense of danger against Edo bakufu that could not find any solution for loose management of finance which suffered a significant income decline in annual rice tax during the Ogosho (retired Shogun) period.

sen.j: しかし、家斉在世中は水野忠篤(旗本)、林忠英、美濃部茂育（3人を総称して天保の三侫人という）をはじめ家斉側近が権力を握っており、忠邦は改革を開始できなかった。
sen.e: However, while Ienari was alive, the Ienari's close advisers including Tadaatsu MIZUNO (hatamoto or bannerman), Tadafusa HAYASHI and Mochinaru MINOBE (the three were comprehensively called Tempo no san-Neijin) wielded dictatorial power in bakufu, which prevented Tadakuni to launch any reform.
sen.cmt: 三侫人：読み方不明です。
sen.e: However, while Ienari was alive, the Ienari's close advisers including Tadaatsu MIZUNO (hatamoto or bannerman), Tadafusa HAYASHI and Mochinaru MINOBE (the three were comprehensively called Tempo no san-Neijin) wielded dictatorial power in bakufu, which prevented Tadakuni from launching any reform.
sen.cmt: prevent from lanchingとしまました。
sen.e: However, while Ienari was alive, the Ienari's close advisers including Tadaatsu MIZUNO (hatamoto or bannerman), Tadafusa HAYASHI and Mochinaru MINOBE (the three were comprehensively called Tempo no san-Neijin) wielded dictatorial power in bakufu, which prevented Tadakuni from launching any reform.

sen.j: 天保8年（1837年）4月に家慶が第12代将軍に就任し、ついで天保12年（1841年）閏1月に大御所・徳川家斉の薨去を経て、家斉旧側近を罷免し、遠山景元、矢部定謙、岡本正成、鳥居耀蔵、渋川敬直、後藤三右衛門を登用して天保の改革に着手した。
sen.e: When Ieyoshi TOKUGAWA became the 12th shogun in April 1837 and Ienari TOKUGAWA, Ogosho, died in leap January 1841, Tadakuni first dismissed close advisors of Ienari and newly employed Kagemoto TOYAMA, Sadanori YABE, Masanari OKAMOTO, Yozo TORII, Hironao SHIBUKAWA and Sanemon GOTO to initiate the Tempo Reforms.

When Ieyoshi TOKUGAWA became the 12th shogun in April 1837 and Ienari TOKUGAWA, Ogosho, died in leap January 1841, Tadakuni first dismissed close advisors of Ienari and newly employed Kagemoto TOYAMA, Sadanori YABE, Masanari OKAMOTO, Yozo TORII, Hironao SHIBUKAWA and Sanemon GOTO to initiate the Tempo Reforms.

When Ieyoshi TOKUGAWA became the 12th shogun in April 1837 and Ienari TOKUGAWA, Ogosho, died in leap January 1841, Tadakuni first dismissed close advisors of Ienari and newly employed Kagemoto TOYAMA, Sadanori YABE, Masanari OKAMOTO, Yozo TORII, Hironao SHIBUKAWA and Sanemon GOTO to initiate the Tempo Reforms.

sen.j: 天保の改革では｢享保・寛政の政治に復帰するように努力せよ｣との覚書を申し渡し｢法令雨下｣と呼ばれるほど多くの法令を定めた。
sen.e: During the Tempo Reforms, a memorandum was issued, which says 'strive hard to revive the politics of Kyoho and Kansei eras', and so many laws were enacted that it was called 'Horei Uka' (laws fall like a rain).
sen.cmt: 法令雨下：読み方不明です。
sen.e: During the Tempo Reforms, a memorandum was issued, which says 'strive hard to revive the politics of Kyoho and Kansei eras,' and so many laws were enacted that it was called 'Horei Uka' (laws fall like a rain).

During the Tempo Reforms, a memorandum was issued, which says 'strive hard to revive the politics of Kyoho and Kansei eras,' and so many laws were enacted that it was called 'Horei Uka' (laws fall like a rain).

sen.j: 農村から多数農民が逃散して江戸に流入している状況に鑑み、農村復興のため人返し令を発し、弛緩した大御所時代の風を矯正すべく奢侈禁止・風俗粛正を命じた。
sen.e: In reflection of a massive influx of peasants from farming villages to Edo, Tadakuni issued the 'Hito gaeshi-rei' (a law to return peasants to their village) to reconstruct faming villages, and also banned luxury goods and reinforced tighter discipline on public morals in order to rehabilitate the city which was loosened up during the Ogosho Period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In reflection of a massive influx of peasants from farming villages to Edo, Tadakuni issued the 'Hito gaeshi-rei' (a law to return peasants to their villages) to reconstruct faming villages, and also banned luxury goods and reinforced tighter discipline on public morals in order to rehabilitate the city which was loosened up during the Ogosho Period.
sen.cmt: their villagesと複数形にしました。
sen.e: In reflection of a massive influx of peasants from farming villages to Edo, Tadakuni issued the 'Hito gaeshi-rei' (a law to return peasants to their villages) to reconstruct faming villages, and also banned luxury goods and reinforced tighter discipline on public morals in order to rehabilitate the city which was loosened up during the Ogosho Period.

sen.j: また、物価騰貴は株仲間に原因ありとして株仲間の解散を命じる低物価政策を実施したが、その一方で低質な貨幣を濫造して幕府財政の欠損を補う政策をとったため、物価引下げとは相反する結果をもたらした。
sen.e: Also, he dissolved merchant guilds as a part of the low-price policy, as he placed a blame on them for rising goods prices, but he minted low-quality coins to compensate the finance shortage of bakufu at the same time, which brought about an outcome completely opposite to a price reduction.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Also, he dissolved merchant guilds as a part of the low-price policy, as he placed a blame on them for rising goods prices, but he minted low-quality coins to compensate the finance shortage of bakufu at the same time, which brought about an outcome completely opposite to a price reduction.

Also, he dissolved merchant guilds as a part of the low-price policy, as he placed a blame on them for rising goods prices, but he minted low-quality coins to compensate the finance shortage of bakufu at the same time, which brought about an outcome completely opposite to a price reduction.

sen.j: また、天保14年（1843年）9月に上知令を断行しようとして大名・旗本の反対に遭うなどした上、腹心の鳥居耀蔵が上知令反対派の老中・土井利位に寝返って機密文書を渡すなどしたため、閏9月13日に老中を罷免されて失脚した。
sen.e: Also, a strong opposition from daimyos and hatamotos to Agechi-rei (confiscation command of territory) was arisen when Tadakuni tried to force it through in September 1843, and treachery by his trusted retainer, Yozo TORII, was revealed, who switched sides and gave classified documents to Toshitsura DOI, anti-Agechi-rei roju, both of which caused the dismissal of Tadakuni from roju on leap September 13 and the ultimate downfall of Tadakuni later.

Also, a strong opposition from daimyos and hatamotos to Agechi-rei (confiscation command of territory) was arisen when Tadakuni tried to force it through in September 1843, and treachery by his trusted retainer, Yozo TORII, was revealed, who switched sides and gave classified documents to Toshitsura DOI, anti-Agechi-rei roju, both of which caused the dismissal of Tadakuni from roju on leap September 13 and the ultimate downfall of Tadakuni later.

Also, a strong opposition from daimyos and hatamotos to Agechi-rei (confiscation command of territory) was arisen when Tadakuni tried to force it through in September 1843, and treachery by his trusted retainer, Yozo TORII, was revealed, who switched sides and gave classified documents to Toshitsura DOI, anti-Agechi-rei roju, both of which caused the dismissal of Tadakuni from roju on leap September 13 and the ultimate downfall of Tadakuni later.

sen.j: 忠邦の改革はあまりに過激な改革で庶民の怨みを買ったとされ、失脚した際には暴徒化した江戸市民に邸を襲撃されている。
sen.e: It is believed that the reform conducted by Tadakuni was so radical that it caused resentment among common people of Edo who ended up raiding his residence upon his discharge from roju.
It is believed that the reform conducted by Tadakuni was so radical that it caused resentment among common people of Edo who ended up raiding his residence upon his discharge from roju.
It is believed that the reform conducted by Tadakuni was so radical that it caused resentment among common people of Edo who ended up raiding his residence upon his discharge from roju.

sen.j: 天保15年（1844年）5月、江戸城本丸が火災により焼失し、その再建費用を老中首座・土井利位が集められなかったことから家慶の不興を買ったため、6月21日に家慶は外国問題の紛糾などを理由に忠邦を老中首座に再任した。
sen.e: However, when the main ward of Edo Castle was burned down in May 1844, a new roju shuza, Toshitsura DOI, could not gather enough money for the reconstruction of the castle, which displeased Ieyoshi and led him reappoint Tadakuni as roju shuza on June 21, under the excuse of complicated foreign issues.

However, when the main ward of Edo Castle was burned down in May 1844, a new roju shuza, Toshitsura DOI, could not gather enough money for the reconstruction of the castle, and this displeased Ieyoshi and led him reappoint Tadakuni as roju shuza on June 21, under the excuse of complicated foreign issues.

However, when the main ward of Edo Castle was burned down in May 1844, a new roju shuza, Toshitsura DOI, could not gather enough money for the reconstruction of the castle, and this displeased Ieyoshi and led him reappoint Tadakuni as roju shuza on June 21, under the excuse of complicated foreign issues.

sen.j: しかし昔日の面影は無く、御用部屋でもぼんやりとしている日々が多かったとされる。
sen.e: However, it is said that Tadakuni was not what he had used to be anymore and often seemed distracted in his office.
However, it is said that Tadakuni was not what he had used to be anymore and often seemed distracted in his office.
However, it is said that Tadakuni was not what he had used to be anymore and often seemed distracted in his office.

sen.j: その一方で天保改革時代に自分を裏切った土井利位や鳥居耀蔵らに報復したりしている。
sen.e: On the other hand, Tadakuni avenged the betrayal during the Tempo Reforms by Toshitsura DOI and Yozo TORII.
On the other hand, Tadakuni avenged on Toshitsura DOI and Yozo TORII who betrayed him during the Tempo Reforms.
sen.cmt: avenge onとして、書き換えました。
sen.e: On the other hand, Tadakuni avenged on Toshitsura DOI and Yozo TORII who betrayed him during the Tempo Reforms.

sen.j: しかし老中・阿部正弘をはじめ、前老中・土井利位らは忠邦の再任に強硬に反対し、忠邦に対しても天保改革時代の鳥居耀蔵や後藤三右衛門らの疑獄の嫌疑が発覚し、弘化2年（1845年）9月に加増のうち1万石、本地のうち1万石、合計2万石を没収されて5万石となった。
sen.e: However, amid the strong opposition to Tadakuni's reappointment from Masahiro ABE, roju, and Toshitsura DOI, the former roju, Tadakuni was suspected of taking a bribe from Yozo TORII and Sanemon GOTO during the Tempo Reforms, which worked as a negative factor to Tadakuni and deprived him of 10,000 goku (2,780 cubic meters) from his additional territory and another 10,000 goku from his original territory as an punitive measure in September 1845, and his territory was reduced to 50,000 goku (13,900 cubic meters).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, amid the strong opposition to Tadakuni's reappointment from roju, Masahiro ABE and the former roju, Toshitsura DOI, Tadakuni was suspected of taking a bribe from Yozo TORII and Sanemon GOTO during the Tempo Reforms, which worked as a negative factor to Tadakuni and deprived him of 10,000 koku (2,780 cubic meters) from his additional territory and another 10,000 koku from his original territory as an punitive measure in September 1845, and his territory was reduced to 50,000 koku (13,900 cubic meters).
sen.cmt: gokuをkokuにし、老中等を名前の前にもってきました。
sen.e: However, amid the strong opposition to Tadakuni's reappointment from roju, Masahiro ABE and the former roju, Toshitsura DOI, Tadakuni was suspected of taking a bribe from Yozo TORII and Sanemon GOTO during the Tempo Reforms, which worked as a negative factor to Tadakuni and deprived him of 10,000 koku (2,780 cubic meters) from his additional territory and another 10,000 koku from his original territory as an punitive measure in September 1845, and his territory was reduced to 50,000 koku (13,900 cubic meters).

sen.j: 家督は長男・水野忠精に継ぐことを許された上で強制隠居・謹慎が命じられた上、まもなく出羽国山形藩に懲罰的転封を命じられた。
sen.e: Tadakuni was placed under house arrest and ordered to retire and later transferred to the Yamagata Domain of Dewa Province, after Tadakiyo MIZUNO, his eldest son, was allowed to succeed the family reigns.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Tadakuni was placed under house arrest and ordered to retire,then later transferred to the Yamagata Domain of Dewa Province, after Tadakiyo MIZUNO, his eldest son, was allowed to succeed the family reigns.

Tadakuni was placed under house arrest and ordered to retire,then later transferred to the Yamagata Domain of Dewa Province, after Tadakiyo MIZUNO, his eldest son, was allowed to succeed the family reigns.

sen.j: 嘉永4年（1851年）2月10日、死去。
sen.e: Tadakuni died on February 10, 1851.
Tadakuni died on February 10, 1851.
Tadakuni died on February 10, 1851.

sen.j: 死後、5日で謹慎が解かれた。
sen.e: His suspension order was lifted five days after his death.
His suspension order was lifted five days after his death.
His suspension order was lifted five days after his death.

tit.e: History of government posts and ranks
History of government posts and ranks
Record of offices and ranks held
tit.cmt: 統一リストの官歴の訳にしました。

sen.j: ※日付は旧暦
sen.e: Dates are based on the old lunisolar calendar.
Dates are based on the old lunisolar calendar.
Date according to old lunar calendar
sen.cmt: 統一リストに従いました。

sen.j: 享和2年（1802年） - 於莵五郎を称する
sen.e: In 1802: Named Otogoro.
In 1802: He called himself, Otogoro.
1802: He called himself, Otogoro.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに従って、In を削除しました。

sen.j: 文化 (元号)2年（1805年）9月 - 諱を忠邦とする。
sen.e: In September 1805: His imina (personal name) was changed to Tadakuni.
In September 1805: His imina (personal name) was changed to Tadakuni.
September 1805: His imina (personal name) was changed to Tadakuni.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに従って、In を削除しました。
統一リストに従って、In を削除しました。

sen.j: 9月7日 - 元服
sen.e: On September 7: Celebrated genpuku (celebration to reach the manhood).
On September 7: He celebrated genpuku (celebration to reach the manhood).
September 7: He celebrated genpuku (celebration to reach the manhood).
sen.cmt: 統一リストに従って、On を削除しました。

sen.j: 11月7日 - 従五位下式部少輔
sen.e: On November 7: Conferred a rank of Jugoinoge and appointed as shikibu shoyu.
On November 7: He was conferred a rank of Jugoinoge and was appointed as shikibu shoyu.
November 7: He was conferred a rank of Jugoinoge and was appointed as shikibu shoyu.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに従って、On を削除しました。

sen.j: 文化9年（1812年）8月 - 家督相続。
sen.e: In August 1812: Succeeded the reigns of the family.
In August 1812: He succeeded the reigns of the family.
August 1812: He succeeded the reigns of the family.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに従って、In を削除しました。

sen.j: 肥前国唐津6万石藩主となり、和泉守に遷任。
sen.e: Inherited the Karatsu Domain (60,000 goku or 16,680 cubic meters) of Hizen Province and appointed as Izumi no kami Guard.
sen.cmt: 遷任：実際赴任したかどうか不確かですので、任命の意で訳しています。
sen.e: He inherited the Karatsu Domain (60,000 goku or 16,680 cubic meters) of Hizen Province and was appointed as Izumi no kami Guard.
He inherited the Karatsu Domain (60,000 koku or 16,680 cubic meters) of Hizen Province and was appointed as Izumi no kami Guard.

sen.j: 文化12年（1815年）11月12日 - 奏者番
sen.e: On November 12, 1815: Promoted to sojaban.
On November 12, 1815: He was promoted to sojaban.
November 12, 1815: He was promoted to sojaban.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに従って、On を削除しました。
統一リストに従って、In を削除しました。

sen.j: 8月 - 遠江国浜松6万石に転封。
sen.e: In August: Changed his territory to Hamamatsu (60,000 goku) of Totoumi Province
In August: He changed his territory to Hamamatsu (60,000 goku) of Totoumi Province.
sen.cmt: 主語を加え、ピリオドも追加しました。
sen.e: August: He changed his territory to Hamamatsu (60,000 koku) of Totoumi Province.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに従って、In を削除しました。 goku→koku

sen.j: 9月10日 - 寺社奉行兼務。
sen.e: On September 10: Additionally appointed as jisha bugyo.
On September 10: He was additionally appointed as jisha bugyo.
September 10: He was additionally appointed as jisha bugyo.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに従って、On を削除しました。

sen.j: 左近衛将監に遷任。
sen.e: Appointed as sakone no shogen (Lieutenant of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards).
sen.cmt: 遷任：実際赴任したかどうか不確かですので、任命の意で訳しています。
sen.e: He was appointed as sakone no shogen (Lieutenant of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards).
He was appointed as sakone no shogen (Lieutenant of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards).

sen.j: 文政8年（1825年）5月15日 - 大坂城代。
sen.e: On May 15, 1825: Promoted to Osaka jodai.
On May 15, 1825: He was promoted to Osaka jodai.
May 15, 1825: He was promoted to Keeper of Osaka-jo Castle.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに従って、On を削除しました。Keeper of Osaka-jo Castle.としました。

sen.j: 従四位下。
sen.e: Conferred a rank of Jushiinoge.
He was conferred a rank of Jushiinoge.
He was conferred a rank of Jushiinoge.

sen.j: 文政9年1826年）
sen.cmt: 統一リストに従って、In を削除しました。

sen.j: 11月23日 - 京都所司代。
sen.e: On November 23: Promoted to Kyoto shoshidai.
On November 23: He was promoted to Kyoto shoshidai.
November 23: He was promoted to Kyoto shoshidai.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに従って、On を削除しました。

sen.j: 侍従兼任。
sen.e: Additionally served as jiju.
He additionally served as jiju.
He additionally served as jiju.

sen.j: 12月 - 越前守に転任。
sen.e: In December: Transferred as Echizen no kami.
In December: He was transferred to Echizen no kami.
December: He was transferred to Echizen no kami.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに従って、In を削除しました。

sen.j: 文政11年（1828年）11月23日 - 西丸老中
sen.e: On November 23, 1828: Promoted to Nishinomaru roju.
On November 23, 1828: He was promoted to Nishinomaru roju.
November 23, 1828: He was promoted to Nishinomaru roju.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに従って、On を削除しました。

sen.j: 天保5年（1834年）3月1日 - 老中（本丸老中）
sen.e: On March 1, 1834: Appointed as roju (Honmaru roju)
On March 1, 1834: He was appointed as roju (Honmaru roju).
sen.cmt: 主語、ピリオドを加えました。
sen.e: March 1, 1834: He was appointed as roju (Honmaru roju).
sen.cmt: 統一リストに従って、On を削除しました。

sen.j: 天保8年（1837年）3月27日 - 勝手掛兼務
sen.e: On March 27, 1837: Additionally appointed as katte gakari.
On March 27, 1837: He was additionally appointed as katte gakari.
March 27, 1837: He was additionally appointed as katte gakari.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに従って、On を削除しました。

sen.j: 天保10年（1839年）12月2日 - 老中首座
sen.e: On December 2, 1839: Promoted to roju shuza.
On December 2, 1839: He was promoted to roju shuza.
December 2, 1839: He was promoted to roju shuza.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに従って、On を削除しました。
統一リストに従って、In を削除しました。

sen.j: 3月 - 人返し令発布。
sen.e: In March: Issued 'Hito gaeshi-rei'.
In March: He issued 'Hito gaeshi-rei'.
March: He issued 'Hito gaeshi-rei'.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに従って、In を削除しました。

sen.j: 6月1日 - 上知令発布。
sen.e: On June 1: Issued 'Agechi-rei'.
On June 1: He issued 'Agechi-rei'.
June 1: He issued 'Agechi-rei'.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに従って、On を削除しました。

sen.j: 閏9月7日 - 上知令撤回。
sen.e: On leap September 7: Withdrew 'Agechi-rei'.
On leap September 7: He withdrew 'Agechi-rei'.
Leap September 7: He withdrew 'Agechi-rei'.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに従って、On を削除しました。

sen.j: 閏9月13日 - 老中御役御免。
sen.e: On leap September 13: Dismissed from roju.
On leap September 13: He was dismissed from roju.
Leap September 13: He was dismissed from roju.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに従って、On を削除しました。

sen.j: 差控。
sen.e: Suspended from a job.
He was suspended from a job.
He was suspended from a job.

sen.j: 雁之間詰。
sen.e: Served as karinomatsume (feudal lord that Karino-ma room in Edo-jo castle was set as his station)
He served as karinomatsume (feudal lord that Karino-ma room in Edo-jo castle was set as his station).
sen.cmt: 主語、ピリオドを加えました。
sen.e: He served as karinomatsume (feudal lord that Karino-ma room in Edo-jo castle was set as his station).

sen.j: 弘化元年（1844年）6月21日 - 老中再任。
sen.e: On June 21, 1844: Reappointed as roju.
On June 21, 1844: He was reappointed as roju.
June 21, 1844: He was reappointed as roju.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに従って、On を削除しました。

sen.j: 老中首座。
sen.e: Promoted to roju shuza.
He was promoted to roju shuza.
He was promoted to roju shuza.

sen.cmt: 統一リストに従って、In を削除しました。

sen.j: 2月22日 - 老中辞職。
sen.e: On February 22: Retired from roju.
On February 22: He retired from roju.
February 22: He retired from roju.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに従って、On を削除しました。

sen.j: 9月2日 - 隠居蟄居。
sen.e: On September 2: Retired and put under house arrest.
On September 2: He retired and was put under house arrest.
September 2: He retired and was put under house arrest.
sen.cmt: 統一リストに従って、On を削除しました。

sen.j: 1万石没収。
sen.e: His 10,000 goku was confiscated.
His 10,000 goku was confiscated.
His 10,000 koku was confiscated.

sen.j: 出羽国山形5万石に転封。
sen.e: Transferred to Yamagata (50,000 goku) of Dewa Province.
He was transferred to Yamagata (50,000 goku) of Dewa Province.
He was transferred to Yamagata (50,000 koku) of Dewa Province.
